name: 餐旅行銷專案管理研究
description: This course is a three-hour graduate survey course focused on the strategic analysis and planning necessary to effectively match marketing strategies with changing macro, micro, and organizational environments. The course is intended to provide an understanding of the conceptual realm of hospitality marketing strategy and knowledge of the factors for consideration in making strategic marketing decisions in the hospitality industry. Pedagogy is based on business simulation, case analysis and discussion.
goals: To improve and broaden the student's abilities to identify hospitality marketing problems and to develop reasoned resolutions of these problems.

To develop an expanded appreciation and understanding of the relationship among marketing decision variables – product, price, promotion and channels – and how the whole package is put together for effectiveness.
To broaden the student's understanding of the scope and role of marketing as a
To examine the ethical challenges and opportunities in business marketing
syllabus:
Week 1 – Introduction to the Course (2/21)

_Week 2 – Holiday (2/28)_

_Week 3 – Introduction to Marketing Management + Characteristics of the Hospitality Industry + The Marketing Environment (SWOT, TOWS, PEST, PESTLE) (Students to form groups) (3/7)_

Week 4 – Market Segmentation, Targeting and Positioning (STP) (3/14)

Week 5 – 7Ps & 7Cs Marketing + Customer Perceived Value (CPV) + Value Proposition (VP) (3/21)

Week 6 – Products and Services – Customer Value / Solution (3/28)

_Week 7 – Holiday (4/4)_

Week 8 – Price – Customer Cost (4/11)

Week 9 – Place – Convenience (4/18)

Week 10 – Promotion – Communication + Internet Marketing + Website Design (4/25)

Week 11 – Social Media Marketing + Content Marketing (Poster + eDM) (5/2)

Week 12 – Market Research (Questionnaire + Focus Group) (5/9)

_Week 13 – Midterm Examination (5/16)_

_Week 14 – Guest Speaker / Field Trip (to be confirmed) (5/23)_

_Week 15 – Branding (Brand, Logo, Corporate Identity System, CIS) (5/30)_

Week 16 – Service Quality Management + Customer Satisfaction (CS) and Customer Loyalty (CL) (6/6)

Week 17 – People (Internal Marketing) + Process + Physical Evidence + Experiential Marketing (Experience Design) (6/13)

_Week 18 – Group Project Presentations (6/20)_

Attend class and participate in in-class discussions and activities.
